summary: The Safe and Open Streets Act (S. 2115) amends Title 18 of the United States Code to establish a criminal penalty for intentionally obstructing, delaying, or affecting commerce by blocking public roads. The bill specifies a penalty of up to 5 years imprisonment and a fine for those convicted. It also makes conforming amendments to related sections of the United States Code, including updating the section heading and the table of sections relating to Title 18, and cross-references in titles 5 and 18.
